text: Hey team, I am trying to run a devnet via docker compose. Noticed some glitches here and there while running w/o auth but in general it was good. Now I switched to auth (added `-a` to the `start.sh`) and validator wont start and is throwing errors. And also accessing wallet or cns UI, the `Log in with oauth2` button is there but it also throws errors if clicked.

elements.text: Hey team, I am trying to run a devnet via docker compose. Noticed some glitches here and there while running w/o auth but in general it was good. Now I switched to auth (added
-a
to the
start.sh
) and validator wont start and is throwing errors. And also accessing wallet or cns UI, the
Log in with oauth2
button is there but it also throws errors if clicked.

text: Is it ok to post the logs here?

elements.text: Is it ok to post the logs here?

text:
I believe the UI errors are due to my failure to set values for some of the environment variables, either by leaving the default values or omitting them entirely. Specifically, these:

```LEDGER_API_AUTH_AUDIENCE
LEDGER_API_AUTH_SCOPE
VALIDATOR_AUTH_AUDIENCE
LEDGER_API_ADMIN_USER```

text: Hey wanted to ask again <@U07JVCE71JM>

elements.text: Hey wanted to ask again

text:
Hey there,
If, for any reason, the validator crashes and needs to be reprovisioned, does the validator need to be re-authenticated? That being said, do we need a new operator secret?

elements.text:
Hey there,
If, for any reason, the validator crashes and needs to be reprovisioned, does the validator need to be re-authenticated? That being said, do we need a new operator secret?

text:
You don't need a new operator secret. If you're using docker compose, you can even just use a dummy value on the start command. it won't be actually use.

Upon succesfullly onboard, the postgres database hold all the key of the validator. It will use it .

You should backup node identities and postgres follow the docs here <https://docs.dev.sync.global/validator_operator/validator_backups.html>

elements.text:

You should backup node identities and postgres follow the docs here

text:
<https://docs.dev.sync.global/validator_operator/validator_helm.html#configuring-authentication>
```LEDGER_API_AUTH_AUDIENCE=<https://canton.network.global>```
Auth Scope I think can be empty.
```LEDGER_API_AUTH_SCOPE=```
Should be The audience for the validator backend API.
```VALIDATOR_AUTH_AUDIENCE=<https://validator.yourdomain.com> possibly with /api on the end ```
Should match the sub field of JWTs issued for the validator app. Depends upon auth provider.
```LEDGER_API_ADMIN_USER=CLIENT_ID@clients  ```

elements.text: LEDGER_API_AUTH_AUDIENCE=

Should be The audience for the validator backend API.
VALIDATOR_AUTH_AUDIENCE=
possibly with /api on the end
Should match the sub field of JWTs issued for the validator app. Depends upon auth provider.
LEDGER_API_ADMIN_USER=CLIENT_ID@clients
